characters: A FLOOD OF MEMORIES ASSAULT HIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVAN, 20, good-looking but with dark haunted eyes, franti hides himself in an unlit Doctor's office. His face and c are covered in blood. He holds his forehead in pain. FLASHLIGHT BEAMS stab through the darkened corridor hunti for him. ALARMS SOUND. GUARDS are heard shouting to each  other. Evan grabs a cardboard box and hides under a docto desk. He grabs some paper and begins writing in shorthand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he writes) If anyone finds this, then I guess  my plan didn't work and I'm already  dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I can just go back to the  beginning of all this, I still might  be able to save her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fatigue overwhelms him, but he continues writing...

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: ANDREA TREBORN, twenty-five, an attractive pregnant woman strapped to a gurney, is rolled down a busy hospital corr She is clearly ready to give birth, and as she flails her arms, she knocks another patient's IV bottle into the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tearful Andrea holds newborn EVAN in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling Andrea holds baby Evan up to the camera, then pla him in a crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A playground. Evan's father, JASON (23), puts a 1-year ol on a slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A birthday party for LENNY, 5, a chubby kid with only a f friends. Evan, now 5, is gently prodded by Andrea toward  KAYLEIGH, 5, a quiet sweet-looking girl with beautiful ha Evan clumsily shakes her hand and she quickly leans over kisses his cheek. He blushes and runs to hug his mother's leg. END MONTAGE & TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the driveway, 7-year old Evan plays with CRICKETT, a f cocker spaniel puppy. Andrea, wearing a mechanic's jumpsuit, works impatiently the carburetor of a Toyota Celica. Evan pets the dog as h watches his mother work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... what now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan quickly eyes the situation and grabs the 5/16" wrenc from the toolbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be late again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you ever care about getting  to school on time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're putting up pictures for Parent's  Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan impatiently watches Andrea turn the bolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Righty-tighty, lefty-lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Don't worry Evan, you'll  have plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carburetor will not set properly. She bangs on it wit the wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: carb) Darn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... can dad come this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting impatient) You know the answer to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't he come out for one day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been over this a hundred times.  It's too dangerous for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lenny said that his dad's  coming... and Tommy and Kayleigh's  dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea hands the wrench to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Ev... Finish this up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan beams as he climbs onto the bumper and screws the ca back together. Andrea, meanwhile, strips off her coveralls, revealing a  spotless nurse's uniform underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the dads are gonna be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the point, kiddo. But I'm not  so bad, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Because I've been waiting to  see your art projects all week and  I'd feel terrible if all you thought  about was your father not being there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, disappointed, passes the wrench back to Andrea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Done. Try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea gets behind the wheel. She turns the ignition and engine roars to life. Evan wears a proud smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're amazing, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea races through the school zone and heads for the ma doors. Evan's already got the car door open and his foot the ground by the time the car skids to a halt. Andrea ch her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay have a great day I love you  I'll pick you up later gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan blows Andrea a kiss goodbye and runs into the school As Andrea pulls away, MRS. BOSWELL, 35, taps the car wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Treborn! I need to speak with  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but can it wait til  tonight? I'm already late for work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell's morbid expression stops Andrea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you really need to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The classroom is filled with screaming, running children. Mrs. Boswell enters the classroom with Andrea and immedia calls out to TOMMY, a tough seven-year old kid who swings whiffle bat at LENNY, now seven, a sniffling, chubby kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY! LEAVE LENNY ALONE! DON'T MAKE  ME SEND YOU TO MR. VOYTEK'S OFFICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is surprised to see his mother enter with Mrs. Boswe but continues playing with Kayleigh, now seven, a quiet,  sweet-looking girl. Mrs. Boswell leads Andrea over to the teacher's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to show this to the  principal, but I wanted to talk to  you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday I had all the children  draw pictures of what they wanted to  be when they grew up. Most of them  made drawings of what their parents  did, but this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Boswell opens the bottom drawer of her desk and pull out a drawing. Andrea turns to stone when she sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand... Evan did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawing shows a child holding a bloody knife while  standing on a heap of dead bodies. It's extremely  sophisticated for a seven-year old. Some of the corpses h been cut open and the insides are surprisingly anatomical correct. Andrea sees Evan playing with Lenny, harmless as a bunny, and struggles to control her concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for showing it to me first.  I'll... I'll take care of it. Can I  have the picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. There is one more thing,  Mrs. Treborn. And I feel bad for  mentioning it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I asked Evan about his drawing,  well, he didn't remember doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea is visibly shaken now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea seems so impacted by this revelation that she cann even start the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children hang artwork on the walls in prep for Parent Night. Each child has a picture of his or her family made from colored construction paper and macaroni. Evan's pict (no longer sophisticated) depicts his mother, Crockett an himself on a green hill. Tommy and Kayleigh's pictures ea show two kids and a single father. And their 'mother' is  stuck to the far end of page. Lenny beams as he pins-up his picture of an ideal nuclear family. He looks at Tommy's picture and is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put the mommy too far away. Mrs.  Boswell has macaroni and glue if you  wanna fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a retard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy lives far away but she comes  and visits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) If I'm retarded, why didn't my mommy  move away from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gets upset. He swipes his hand down Lenny's picture and his macaroni "mother" crumbles to the floor. Lenny be to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat little baby, crying for mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan takes the ruined picture and leans down next to Lenn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Lenny. It's not that bad.  You can still see your mom a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, unable to stop crying, begins hyperventilating out control. His desperate gasps for breath are frightening. Evan, scared, looks around for Mrs. Boswell, but cannot f her. He reaches up to his own picture and quickly tears h own macaroni "mother" apart and places it over Lenny's  picture. It's a nuclear family again. Lenny slowly is abl to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grateful) Can... can... Can I have this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I was gonna make a new one,  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh helps Lenny glue a new "mother" in place and she smiles gratefully at Evan. As Evan smiles back at Kayleigh, Mrs. Boswell calmly ente the room in time to see Evan tacking up his butchered fam portrait. She shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gothic. Imposing. Andrea runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. HARLON REDFIELD, 40, a handsome and extremely genial  man, scrutinizes a disturbing drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say he doesn't remember any  of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) Not according to his teacher. It  just got me thinking about Jason and  what if Evan's inherited his father's  condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it, Andrea. Let's not  jump to conclusions. I'll run some  preliminary tests, see what we can  rule out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea nods and forces a thankful smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, bring Evan here tonight  and we'll run a CAT-scan series.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The looming building looks even more frightening at night Andrea and Evan head up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this place, Mom. It's  creepy. Please can we go? I promise  I won't make any more bad pictures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighthearted) You'll be fine. Dr. Redfield just  wants to give you some tests. You'll  like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea leads Evan into Dr. Redfield's office. Dr. Redfiel warmly greets Evan at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Evan. It's very nice to meet  you. (to Andrea) He's as handsome as his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) You know my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Dr. Redfield can answer, Andrea cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I wanted you to come here,  Evan. Dr. Redfield already has a  background in memory loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father has a bad memory, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Andrea's look) Uh, tell you what, Evan. If it's  okay with your mother, I'd like to  run some tests. Nothing scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan raises an eyebrow at the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it might be a little scary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks terrified as he lies on a medical platform as series of CAT-scan images are taken. In another part of t room, a distressed Andrea speaks quietly with Dr. Redfiel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me that Evan doesn't have  Jason's illness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Andrea, I'm sure he'll test  negative for brain disorders. But  there's something else you can try  to monitor his memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A journal. Just have him write down  everything he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be extremely useful to jog  his memory. See if he remembers  anything new the next day. And I'll  have the test results back in a few  days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning. Evan busily writes in his new black-mar mead comp book:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S DIARY
dialogues.text: "Today Mommy is taking me to play with Kayley and Tommy. will mete there father and see what a real dad is like. M one day I will mete my Dad." Andrea, meanwhile, speaks into the phone as she pours Luc Charms into a cereal bowl for Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, George. I really appreciate  you watching him, he won't be any  trouble at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan puts down the journal and eats breakfast. He separat the green clovers from the cereal and drops them to the f for Crockett to nibble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These'll bring you luck, Crockett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Great. I'll see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea hangs up the phone and walks into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea grabs the pocket book off the coffee table and hea back into the kitchen. She drops her purse in shock when sees: Evan, in doorway, expressionless and holding a larg BUTCHER KNIFE by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sees her but remains expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan? What are you doing with that  knife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life suddenly springs into Evan's face. He seems stunned find himself holding the knife and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey. What were you doing with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears welling) I... I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, still shaken, drops Evan off at the house of GEOR MILLER, 35, a handsome athletic man with an infectious sm He approaches the car and opens the door for Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Andrea. (to Evan) Hello little man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea writes nervously on a piece of paper as Evan gets  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot George. Here's my work  number in case there are any problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighthearted laughter) Whaddaya kidding? We're going to  have a great time today, right Evan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea nods thanks and nervously drives away. Evan walks to Mr. Miller and momentarily reaches for his hand. Mr. M flinches his hand away and chuckles at Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You waiting for an invitation? The  kids are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan appears confused for a moment at Mr. Miller's unexpe rudeness, but walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters the well-kept middle class home and sees his  classmates Kayleigh and Tommy. Kayleigh is dressed in a m shift Medieval gown and Tommy is also dressed in a period costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited to see Evan) Evan, guess what? Dad got a new video  camera and we're all gonna be in a  movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Evan gets to be in it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit it, Tommy. Evan gets to be Robin  Hood. I'm gonna be Maid Marian, and  you're the Sheriff of Nottingham!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was the bad guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, silly. He's a bad sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller, holding a full glass of scotch in one hand, s the circa-80's bulky video camera on a tripod and plugs i into the porta-deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're really gonna be in a movie!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Evan, and you get to  be the star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was the star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, moron. Now get in your  costume, Evan. And you have to  promise, your bestest super-duper  promise, that this will be our little  secret. Think you can do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods and sticks his arms straight up in the air. Mr. Miller downs his drink and helps Evan off with his clothe Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to in an unfamiliar place. The rec-room/baseme Evan's eyes dart from the fireplace to Mr. Miller's camer lens and finally to Kayleigh, whose ashen face trembles  slightly. Panic spreads across Evan's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? What happened? Where did  we all go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, kid. Stand still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan backs up and awkwardly scurries around the basement, grabbing his clothes. Panicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just somewhere else -- how did  I get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit acting like some retard or I'll  call your mother and tell her what a  naughty little shit you've been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh's eyes are unable to leave the floor. She begins adjusting her disheveled clothing. Evan trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy silently watches from the top of the basement stair absently wringing the head off one of his sister's dolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield places Evan's CAT-scan slides on the light b Andrea squints, unable to interpret them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the good news is that the  results are negative. I've found no  evidence in the way of lesions,  hemorrhaging, tumors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, we've got nothing to  work with. It's harder playing  detective now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you must have something to go  on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had to guess, I'd say the  blackouts are stress related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's seven. What kind of stress  can he have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plenty. Who knows? Maybe he's got  severe coping problems about not  having a father. Did you say the  last blackout occurred when he was  with his friend's dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I doubt the answer's that  simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised how often they  are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he has been pushing me to meet  his father, but I've been putting it  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worth a shot. I can arrange a  controlled meeting. A careful dose  of sedatives for Jason, some security,  you and I monitoring. Evan comes in  for a quick visit and with any luck,  no more missing father complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, dressed in his Sunday best, writes copiously in a  journal marked "AGE 7."

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S DIARY
dialogues.text: "April 15. Today I get to mete my father. His name is Jas and he is crazy. I hope he lets me call him dad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea tightly grips Evan's hand as the pair follow Dr.  Redfield down a corridor. Evan's enthusiasm is dampened b the sounds of distant screams and bloodcurdling laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad lives here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this wing, actually. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now your father may seem sleepy to  you, but that's just because of his  medicine, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to the end of the corridor and come to a "Visit Chamber". Dr.Redfield leads Evan inside. Andrea begins to follow, b the doctor gestures that she stay outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan takes a seat at a long rectangular table. His eyes a fixated on the door on the other side of the room. Finall a dark figure can be seen through the opaque glass. JASON, thirty and haggard looking, enters the room. His e want to sparkle at seeing his son for the first time. But tranquilizers have dulled the effect. Evan's eyes fixate on the leg-restraints and handcuffs th hinder Jason's movement. Finally Jason sits. He smiles warmly and speaks in over-enunciated tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I won't bite. You've seen  pictures of me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Mom says I have your eyes  and your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan "comes to" in another unfamiliar place. Rather than  seeing his father across a table, he's looking up at a  ceiling. Blocking his view of the ceiling is Jason, whose face is monstrous with rage, and whose cuffed hands are wrapped a Evan's throat, choking the life out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched  teeth) I... love... you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, ORDERLIES tackle Jason from both sides and wedg baton under his jaw to wrench him away. Andrea franticall struggles to rescue Evan from Jason's clutches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicking) He has to die! You don't understand!  It's the only way to stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason wrestles the baton from under his chin, hits an ord in the kneecap and comes for Evan with the baton! Orderly #2 acts quickly, beating Jason with his baton. As Jason makes another desperate grab for Evan, Orderly #2 i forced to bash him in the skull. Down for the count. Andrea hugs Evan, now in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Evan. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ALARM sounds and Andrea tries to cover Evan's eyes, b through her fingers he can see a quick blur of a pool of  blood spreading from Jason's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in black, Andrea and Evan watch Jason's casket be lowered into the ground. Andrea's tears soak through her  veil. A few feet back, Kayleigh stands behind Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashes to ashes... dust to dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan watches the coffin descend, disappearing from sight. Kayleigh steps up to Evan and takes his hand. A moment. A she softly whispers in Evan's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better off anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rumble of thunder. Evan looks up at the brooding dark  clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gray skies. Andrea drives the children home. Evan stares the passing tombstones that flutter by like a white picke fence. The flickering strobe effect that intensifies into white blur is hypnotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright and sunny. The lawn freshly cut. A Toro lawnmower been carelessly left in the grass-strewn driveway.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN to the window of the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, Kayleigh, Tommy and Lenny are now THIRTEEN. Evan ex cigarette smoke, taps his ash and finishes sketching a  portrait of Kayleigh in his journal. Tommy wears a leather jacket and now has traces of peach  fuzz on his upper lip. Kayleigh's hair is longer now, albeit stringy and unkempt Evan closes his journal and coolly ignites a STRIKE-ANYWH MATCH with his thumb and lights Kayleigh's cigarette. Eve but Lenny smokes in the basement. Tommy, now with longer hair, ransacks his father's army l looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, I'm bored shitless over here.  What's up already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horses, man. It's here  somewhere. I saw it when I was a  kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy absently chucks an old Playboy toward Lenny. Kaylei seems uncomfortable by the sight of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) We should go soon. If Dad catches us  smoking down here, we're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's go. This place creeps me  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan claps his hands and stands up, Lenny and Kayleigh jo him. Finally, Tommy shakes an old army thermos and hears  something rattling inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it had something to do with  the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy opens the thermos, tips it over and a blockbuster ( stick of dynamite) spills out. Tommy grins mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's blow the shit out of something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy leads Evan, Kayleigh and Lenny on a mission through the woods. Everyone smokes except Lenny, yet he's the onl one who's wheezing. He pulls out an inhaler and takes a p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, slow up, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, did I tell you? My mother said  I might be able to visit her this  summer in Orlando with her new family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say about mentioning that  bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Where the hell are you taking us  anyway? Just blow something up  already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just blow something up? Are you nuts?  There's an art to mass destruction.  Would you just paint the Mona Lisa?  No. Besides, we're here already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now at the edge of the woods, Tommy spots:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAILBOX sits at the end of the driveway. It's exquisite An exact replica of a Colonial home it serves. Across the street, Tommy hands the blockbuster to Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recoiling) What? No frigging way, man. I'm not  touching that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you aren't. Anyone of us  does it, you'll puss out and narc  for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't gonna work this time, buddy.  Look how small that fuse is! I'll  get killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn to Evan as he takes his lit cigarette, brea off the filter and jams the fuse into the unlit end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should buy you ten minutes at  least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny paces back and forth next to the three-story mailbo desperately trying to appear nonchalant. He pretends to n his shoe's untied and bends down to tie it. From the wood the other kids watch anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake, just do it,  Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Lenny throws the bomb in the mailbox. Then sprin like hell to the woods. Kayleigh shakes Lenny's inhaler a hands it to him when he gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking puff) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan pats Lenny on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got balls, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four watch the mailbox in intense anticipation. Evan  smiles with the cigarette pressed tightly between his lip and places his hands over Kayleigh's ears. She smiles bac at him and presses his hands against her head. Tommy catc this and seems disturbed, and quickly turns back to -- The mailbox. Tick-tock... tick-tock... It's like a starin contest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, running full speed, comes to in an unfamiliar place He instantly loses his footing and falls to the ground. L falling on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! Let's go! Get him up, Evan!  Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) What happened?? Where are we?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan gets up and starts running, then realizes he's not b followed. Kayleigh and Tommy are helping Lenny up and car him. Evan realizes that Lenny's completely dazed. Evan do back, grabs Lenny's arm and he and Tommy drag Lenny throu the woods as fast as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Oh God... what did we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Lenny. What's happened to you!  We've gotta get help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea's car screeches to the curb of Lenny's house. Lenn mother, Mrs. Kagan, frantically loads Lenny into an ambul As Andrea rushes up to the ambulance, Mrs. Kagan gives he an icy glare and slams the ambulance door in Andrea's fac Andrea turns to Evan, now trembling on the front stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring menacingly  at the others) We were just building a fort in the  woods when Lenny freaked out. One  minute he was fine, then he just  froze up. Right guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Evan? The truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something must've happened! What set  him off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I blacked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (building frustration) Don't try to use your blackouts to  get out of this one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not making this up, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan shakes his head "no". Almost ashamed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan lies on a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every breath you exhale, you  can feel all of the tension draining  from your body like water through a  faucet. Nine, ten, and you're  completely asleep. Relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan breathes slowly. Deeply. Andrea watches nervously fr the far side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want you to go back to the  time you were in the woods with Lenny.  Think of it like a movie. You can  pause, rewind, or slow down any  details you wish. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing next to Kayleigh, my  hands are over her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurting her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, protecting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea suppresses the tiniest of proud smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then go a little forward in  time. What do you see now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's eyes suddenly roll back in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tell me about the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan moans and begins shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Nothing can hurt you. Remember,  this is only a movie. You're  completely safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moaning) I can't... the car vanishes and all  of a sudden I'm on the ground in the  woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car doesn't vanish Evan. The  movie in your head has broken, that's  all. But now I've re-spliced it and  I want you to tell me about the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming... argh! I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan moans and shakes on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight it Evan. Hurry. It's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood begins to trickle from Evan's nose as a guttural so is uttered from deep within him. Dr. Redfield bolts uprig in his chair and redirects the session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Evan. Listen to my voice! On  the count of ten, you're going to  wake up. Feeling refreshed and  remembering everything we talked  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan moans in agony. Andrea darts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to him?? Make it  stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield waves her away and concentrates on Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. You're feeling more awake now.  Two, your eyes no longer feel heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea moves to stop the blood flowing from Evan's nose. lifts Evan's eyelids and sees only the whites of his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five. Six. Refreshed and awake! Seven,  eight. Come on, Evan, wake up, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is completely non-responsive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan wake up, oh please wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine, ten. And you're awake! Open  your eyes, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but moans and blood. Dr. Redfield frantically ope some desk drawers until he finds smelling salts. He break small capsule under evan's mouth, pinches his bleeding no closed and lets Evan inhale the vapor through his mouth. Evan lurches forward on the couch and falls off. Holding bloody nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan deduces the answer from everyone's horrified faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea drops off Evan, Kayleigh and Tommy outside the com Kayleigh, looking morose, shuts the car door and Andrea d off. They walk through the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kayleigh) Wipe that sad-assed look off your  face before you get us all busted.  You see the way Evan's mom was looking  at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would someone just tell me already  what the hell happened in the mailbox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On "mailbox", Tommy suddenly grabs Evan's jacket and SHOV him against a parked car. Tommy looks around to make sure nobody heard anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever bring that shit up again.  Not ever. Not to me, not to Kayleigh,  or even Lenny. The stupid fuck if he  ever learns to talk again. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods, scared. Tommy gives a final shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever. (re: Kayleigh) She don't want to talk about it,  anyway. Do you Kayleigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's right. Kayleigh clearly doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh shuffles behind Evan and Tommy as they head towa the theatre. Evan drops back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh says nothing as Tommy sees the theatre playing S and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea does the dishes as the TV plays a NEWSCAST in the  b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV) ...was the grizzly aftermath of what  police officials of upstate New York  are calling a horrible act of  vandalism gone awry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea turns to the TV, blocking our view. We can only he the report as she watches intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powerful explosion is believed  to have been caused by a small  quantity of dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea's face looks haunted by the on-screen images. She  shakes her head in terror and grabs the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police thus far have no leads as to  the suspects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks off the TV, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie's in progress. Evan and Kayleigh sit behind Tom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Look at that fat fuck!  You'd have to wipe his ass with a  forklift!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some crowd members TURN around and give Tommy a SHUSH. To whips M&Ms at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, faggot. No one's talking to  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh, repulsed, suddenly darts from the aisle and run out. Evan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan follows her to a small alcove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Kayleigh. This was a bad  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't remember anything  that happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan shakes his head "no". She looks devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to cry. Evan makes sure no one's staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be okay. Lenny'll be  fine. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches to comfort her. But she winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls her sleeve up, revealing a large bruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Mrs. Kagan called  dad and blamed us for what happened  to Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Your dad did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh pulls back her shirt collar to show an even larg darker bruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down) I deserve a lot worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? What you  deserve is a better brother and  father. All they do is make you feel  like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really have no clue how beautiful  you are, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She searches his eyes for sincerity. And finds it. They l into each other for a TENDER KISS. After a moment, a ROAR from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jerk back to see Tommy, shocked and betrayed, starin at them from across a small crowd. By now, some teens chu at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buying popcorn, what the fuck are  you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy rushes through the small crowd at Evan. His hands i fists. Suddenly a FOOT reaches out and trips Tommy. Tommy falls to the floor and the crowd cackles at him. Tommy slowly gets up, locks eyes with Evan. Hatred oozing Evan looks guilty, weakly shaking his head, it's not what you're thinking. Tommy suddenly lunges at the TEEN PUNK who must be at lea a foot taller than he is. Tommy lands a flurry of punches before the Teen Punk can even defend himself, frequently  taking opportunities to eyeball Evan. Evan, Kayleigh and even the punk's FRIENDS look on helple when TWO SECURITY GUARDS SEIZE TOMMY. Tommy valiantly  struggles against them at first. But the moment he realiz it's hopeless, he allows his body to go slack. As Tommy is being dragged away, he turns to Evan, a sick  smile on his face.  Evan and Kayleigh look back, speechle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea drives through the winding roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea's eyes. Tormented. REVEAL she's driving Evan and Kayleigh home. Evan's up fr and Kayleigh sits behind them. Everyone silent. Andrea stares through the rearview mirror into Kayleigh's eyes. Probing. Searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how was the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea watches Kayleigh. A calculated beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any exploding mailboxes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh flinches at the question. And Andrea catches it. Evan can't help but look back at Kayleigh. Oh my god, she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faking poorly) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea pulls the car over and stops. After a moment, Kayl realizes she's at her house. She exits the car in a hurry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea stares at Evan, who keeps his eyes facing dead ahe She finally shifts the car into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "For Sale" sign is now planted on the front lawn. Andre in her nurse uniform, exits the house to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan discreetly watches her leave through the window. Gra his coat and exits frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh and Evan walk down toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe Tommy's still pissed  at me. He knows I'm moving away,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been acting real strange lately.  He won't even look me in the eyes  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck, here they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a station wagon rolls up the street, Evan and Kayleigh duck in nearby bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your mom say if Lenny was...  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be. They're letting him go,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon finally heads into the driveway. Evan p on a smile and charges the car, pounding the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Lenny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the car, Lenny jerks back in horror. Mrs. Kagan lo angry as she rolls the window down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your little homecoming's in  bad taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile fades from Evan's face. Kayleigh hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acidic) Lenny's been through a hell of an  ordeal no thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh look guilty as the garage door opens up and Mrs. Kagan continues into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Lenny concentrates on a MODEL AIRPLANE. There is a sudden KNOCK at the window. Lenny's head jerks around to Evan and Kayleigh smiling through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh stand on the ivy-covered trellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Welcome home. Thought you might like  some fresh air for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny twitches ever-so-slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tommy with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny looks back at the model airplane. Needs to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, Lenny and Kayleigh pass a junk pile in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lenny) So what did you do in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was awful. You can't sleep 'cause  everyone's screaming all night long.  I never want to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evan and Kayleigh absorb this in silence, they see a c of smoke billowing in the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh run toward the smoke. Lenny nervously  follows behind. They exit the woods to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy has stuffed a dog into a gunny sack which he douses with lighter fluid. Next to a campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crockett!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh rush toward the trapped, helpless dog.  Tommy is ready for them. He drops the lighter fluid, pick up a wooden plank and SWINGS! Evan ducks back at the last minute and Tommy accidentally connects with Kayleigh's he Knocking her unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you made me do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, enraged, fakes a high swing, then goes for Evan's  knee cap. BASH! Evan doubles over in pain and falls to th ground, clutching his knee. Tommy moves to the fire, Croc squirming inside the bag and picks up the lighter fluid. Evan painfully looks up from the ground and his eyes dart from the sight of Kayleigh, unconscious, to Crockett, tra in the tied gunny sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you fucking kiss her, Prince  Charming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy squeezes the bottle hard, creating a flaming fuse f the campfire to the fluid soaked dog. As the flames near Crockett, Evan, seething with rage, st up with clenched fists and CHARGES Tommy at FULL SPEED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to in an unfamiliar place. Still in running mo His body contorts spastically like a fish on land, since is now lying face down on the ground. Evan regains himself and sits up painfully. His face is b bruised and he clutches his battered ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets no answer from Lenny, who stands in the exact sam spot. Tommy is nowhere in sight and the sound is of Kayle weeping. Evan spins to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh?! Are you okay? Where's  Crockett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh, her knees drawn tightly to her chest, is unable answer through her tears. Evan struggles to rise but he  becomes dizzy and falls back to the ground. Evan takes a quick glance toward the gunny sack, smoulder then moans and buries his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small neighborhood CROWD has gathered to watch an ambul with the SUNNYVALE insignia take an entranced Lenny away. Mrs. Kagan is about to climb in the rear when she stops a turns to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ice cold) Do you know what you are? A monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan stands there, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed U-HAUL sits in front of Evan's house. Andrea shi the small truck into gear and slowly pulls out. Outside the truck, Kayleigh waves to Evan, tears spilling shamelessly down her cheeks. Evan reaches behind his seat and opens a large cardboard box. It is filled with past  journals. He finds the most recent journal, uncaps a pen writes something. Finished he presses the journal to the window.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S DIARY
dialogues.text: "I'll come back for you." Evan waves back to her, trying nonchalantly to wipe away own tears as she fades into the distance. When Kayleigh disappears from sight, Andrea looks over to see what he's written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan returns the journal and begins writing furiously.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Evan, twenty now, continues writing in a college Blue Boo He is older, dressed down in worn jeans, T-shirt and plai flannel. He closes the Blue Book with a cocky grin just a PROFESSOR CARTER, 40, calls out to the class:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time! Please place your blue books  on my desk before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan grabs his psychology textbook from under his seat, g up and turns in his exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do, Evan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan flashes a confident smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I might have gotten  some stories mixed up. Did Pavlov  condition his dogs to lick his nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Typical psych major. A complete wise  ass. And how's your project coming?  Still planning to change the way we  humble scientists view memory  assimilation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Hey, I got no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Carter nods solemnly, obviously in the know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan bikes past students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan bikes past some obnoxious GREEKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan docks his bike and carries his knapsack inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's dorm is cluttered "double" whose walls are adorned with head-shop posters of Gothic rock bands. By Evan's bed is a bookshelf filled with books on amnesia memory loss, fugues, hypnotism and other related bands. Evan's roommate, THUMPER, 19, is a completely punked out  Gothic boy who weighs 300 pounds. He currently hands a bl lacy dress to CRICKET, 17, a pierced Goth co-ed. She slip the tattered dress on as Thumper wipes his post-coital se off with a black tee-shirt. Evan barges through the door, throwing his pscyh books on the bed and politely looking away from the half-naked gir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Smells like patchouli and...  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan opens the window and checks out his Psych project: a small maze has several flatworms at one end and a bowl of cornflakes at the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cricket, meet my well-mannered  roommate, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cricket puts on her Doc Martens as Evan watches the worms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're the one who fucked up  the bell-curve on my Anthropology  final. Later, Thumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she leaves, Thumper takes the black T-shirt by his wal and throws it on Evan's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, bro. Found your T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods thanks, picks up his journal. Reads something a smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed, Thumper, you're taking  me out for my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were a December baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bigger. Seven years to the  day. No blackouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper pulls out a bong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A popular watering hole. A dark rustic interior, blasting alternative rock. Plenty of underage students carry pitchers of beer to the tables. Evan and Thumper play pool against two young women. HEIDI beautiful, wears ripped jeans, no make up. She sinks the  eleven ball off the rail. KRISTEN coolly smokes a cigaret confident that she and Heidi will hold the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... which one of you has a pet  worm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper proudly steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worms, plural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper steps back, points to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him about it, he's got the  fetish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi sinks another ball and looks up at Evan strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, they're for a psych project.  A study on memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi misses her shot and passes the cue to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stifling a yawn) Shit, better explain before all the  excitement gives me a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan speaks as he knocks the one-ball in the corner pocke As he talks, at a table behind them, some obnoxious Greek including HUNTER, SPENCER, and GWEN make fun of Thumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an experiment with flatworms  and a maze. You take a flatworm and  run it through the maze until he's  memorized it. Then you put a new  flatworm in the maze. He's clueless.  Banging into walls, getting lost,  whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Like Ozzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen giggles as Spencer throws popcorn at Thumper's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks says he eats it off the  floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper seems oblivious to their taunts as Evan knocks th three-ball in the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chop up the smart flatworm and  feed it to the dumb one and presto,  the dumb one suddenly knows the maze  inside and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan walks past Heidi, putting his hand on her shoulder t squeeze by. The hand lingers longer than necessary and He doesn't mind. He sinks another ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just by absorbing the first worm  into its cellular structure, it gets  all of the worm's memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) That's probably why Hannibal Lecter's  so smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of popcorn hits Thumper's face. They all try to ignore Hunter and Spencer's jeers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting up the eight) Maybe if I can figure out how the  memories of a simple worm function,  it'll help me understand the  complexities of the human brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another barrage of popcorn hits Thumper's jacket. Althoug his hand clenches on the cue. He meekly shuffles away to opposite side of the pool table from the cackling Greeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued) So are you planning on becoming a  doctor or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper casually takes the pool cue from Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just don't want to lose my  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Heidi digests this, Thumper carefully lines up his sho The eight ball. CRASH!!! The cue ball intentionally jumps the table, rock into the pitcher of beer on the Greek's table. They're al soaked with beer and debris. Just as they begin to rise, Thumper smashes the cue stick the table, WHISTLING innocently (while now brandishing a  spear). They sit the fuck down. Kristin, impressed, casually wraps her arm around Thumper waist. He smiles coolly, it's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heidi) I think that's your game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Heidi, making out, burst through the door and fa on the bed. Evan's shirt is unbuttoned and Heidi strokes chest. Suddenly Heidi stops and sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like sex in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper had a busy afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding. He's so... big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan drunkenly crosses the room, grabs two beers from the mini-fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charisma and eyeliner go a long way,  I guess. Wanna beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi takes one. Looks under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most guys tuck their porn under here,  but all you have are... comp books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've been keeping journals  since I was seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (respectfully) Wow... read something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan chugs his beer and sits next to her on the bed and p his arm around her. Very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, I'd be too embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi teasingly runs her fingers over his smooth torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then keep drinking, worm-boy. You're  too uptight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! No "worm-boy". No "Mr. Worm,"  and no "Worm-Master-General!" Once  you get a nickname like that you  can't shake it. And I don't want  everyone thinking I've got tapeworms  coming out of my ass or something,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Deal. Now read me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi hands him a book marked "AGE 13". He flips it open a random place and takes the beer from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: her beer) For courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan takes and finishes her beer and begins reading. As h reads, he seems more and more on the verge of passing out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like my mind refused to believe  what it was seeing. Hearing Crockett  make those awful screams... Just  writing about it gives me the shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he's  reading. He looks over at Heidi, who kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like Tommy was possessed or  something. There was a hate in his  eyes that I couldn't really call  human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evan reads, the world seems to ALMOST IMPERCEPTIBLY VI around him LIKE A TUNING FORK. His voice becomes distant SOUNDS ECHO around him like distant memories resurrecting themselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is THIRTEEN again. The scene begins exactly where Ev blackout occurred as a child. Tommy has just knocked Kayl unconscious with a wooden plank, Lenny is frozen at the s of Crockett in the fluid-soaked gunny sack. And Evan, see with rage, stands up with clenched fists and CHARGES Tomm at full speed. Evan looks around, utterly confused by his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before an answer comes, Tommy smiles at his good fortune swings the plank, hitting Evan's head. Evan is sent spraw backwards, his forehead bleeding freely. Tommy knocks Evan hard in the ribs with his boots. Evan  writhes in agony, his face against the ground. Lenny move toward the gunny sack, lifts it and tugs desperately on t rope that traps Crockett inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't undo the rope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy spins around and flashes an evil smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it or I'll slit your mother's  throat in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if on cue, Lenny does exactly as he's told. His eyes b to glaze over. Evan, beaten and bloody, reaches out with his last bit of strength, grabs Tommy's foot and holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him, Lenny. Help Crockett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny remains frozen in place. Tommy yanks his leg back,  breaking Evan's grip. Evan groans on the ground in a writhing heap. Tommy's voice hitches. His eyes water from pent up  frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me good, Evan. There's a  million other sisters in the world.  You didn't have to fuck with mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy smiles viciously at Lenny, traumatized to watch Tom pick up the lighter fluid and spray a liquid fuse from th campfire to the soaked gunny sack.

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH OF FLAMES
dialogues.text: And Evan passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heidi rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, idiot. It was just a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and angrily puts on her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked out) It didn't feel like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe because they never do. (sarcastic) So Don Juan, you pass out on all  your dates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan doesn't even hear her. After getting his bearings, h grabs his jacket and exits, leaving her dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan drives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, exhausted, finally pulls into Lenny's driveway. Ver little has changed in the past seven years.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Now 20, making a model airplane. He's still overweight an looks like his mother dresses him.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: The room is filled with model airplanes. Hundreds of them A KNOCK on Lenny's bedroom door. Mrs. Kagan, grayer, fatt opens the door and escorts Evan inside. She glares at Eva while pretending to be cheerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a surprise for you, Lenny.  You'll never guess who's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny looks up to see Evan, his jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN
dialogues.text: Looking around, shocked to see: PAN ALL THE WAY AROUND THE ROOM. Nothing has changed in the past seven years.  The same kids' toys, posters and comic books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see he's working on the model again, in his own world. The window of opportunity for conversation has closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, it's me. Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Lenny frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you're working on? A  model?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you look busy, so maybe I should  make this quick. I'd totally  understand if you didn't want to get  into this right now, but that day at  the junkyard, could you help me  remember what happened? Any details?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't cut the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (containing excitement) Yeah, good, what else do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it or I'll slit your mother's  throat in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, startled, drops the model on the desk. An epiphany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. It really happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I can get back all my lost  memories with my journals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With lightning speed, Lenny jumps from his desk and  unexpectedly shoves EVAN IN TO THE WALL. Squadrons of han planes crash to the floor. Lenny digs his fingers into Ev shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make one peep and I swear it'll be  your last, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is terrified. Then Lenny suddenly moves back and beg working on the model again, his eyes a million miles away Evan is speechless. The door bursts open. Mrs. Kagan looks at the smashed mod airplanes by Evan's feet. Evan ignores her accusing stare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for seeing me, man. I  shouldn't have waited so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Lenny doesn't respond, Mrs. Kagan hustles Evan back  into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan pulls a dozen journals from beneath his bed and begi pouring over them. Nearby, Thumper empties a can of hairspray into his Mohaw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think he wanted to kill  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that I might be able  to unblock some of my repressed  memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds something he's looking for, marks the page with yellow post-it note marked, BLACKOUT and sets the book in separate pile. As he sets the next journal on the bed, it automatically  opens up to a place where the spine was bent. Staring up him is the message:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S DIARY
dialogues.text: "I will come back for you." Evan looks overcome by guilt. Later that evening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan has now organized a pile of five journals. He select an entry, begins reading and suddenly closes the journal. Fear covers his face. He holds one of his hands up and is surprised to see it trembling. He opens his journal again and reads out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) The last thing I remember before the  blackout was holding my hands over  Kayleigh's ears... (his voice slowly  fades) I think I was more focused on her  hands on mine than the mailbox across  the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His own words grow reverberant, distant. Furthermore, the walls behind him vibrate, slightly worse than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the  mailbox across the street with intense anticipation. When Evan comes to in this memory, the lit cigarette abse drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his sh SMOLDERING. The mailbox... tick-tock, tick-tock... Like a staring con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it went out. Should someone  check it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you do that, Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a car appears from down the street and slowly pu into the driveway. MRS. HALPERN, 24, an attractive young mother, gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. Across the street, Tommy digs his fingers into the nerves Lenny's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make one peep and I swear it'll be  your last, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's words make Evan flinch. From inside the car, a BA begins to cry. Mrs. Halpern walks back to the car. Evan looks on in horror and suddenly clenches his teeth i pain and silently swipes the front of his shirt, sending lit cigarette to the ground. He pulls up his shirt reveal a fresh BURN MARK on his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my sweet girl? Awww, you need  a change, don't you honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Halpern picks her up and carries her to the house. A the mother unlocks the front door to the house, the kids  break into wide smiles of relief. But wait... The mother remembers the mail and carries the baby back t the mailbox. Now Tommy is the only one left still smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to open the door, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby fumbles with the mailbox's door handle for a mom

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The blast is deafening. Evan, Kayleigh and Lenny watch th results in stunned horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! Run!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh slowly back away in shock and begin to a few steps when they realize that Lenny isn't with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny? Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny doesn't seem to hear, his eyes fixated on the crims road. Evan and Tommy double back and grab him. They try t make him break out into a run, but Lenny's feet drag limp against the ground. Both Tommy and Evan grab an arm and b to run with Lenny through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to. Lurches his body over the bed and vomits. Sounds of squeaky bed springs fill the room. Looking sick and pale, he lifts his shirt to see a NEW SCAR from the  cigarette burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next bed, Thumper's head, wrapped in a blanket, po up from above a NAKED GESELA'S waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, man. You wanna clean that up  before I lose my appetite here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sits upright in bed and begins writing in the margin of the journal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is decorated with colorful streamers, balloons, posters and banners announcing PARENTS' WEEKEND. Carefree STUDENTS and their parents carry shopping bags t the bustling elevators. Evan leans against the side of a phone, holding his ear to drawn out the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, uh, Mrs. Kagan, this is  Evan Treborn. (rolling eyes) I know. I'm sorry about that. But I  really need to speak with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's obviously hung up on him. Suddenly, a HAND grabs hi shoulder. It's PROFESSOR CARTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Didn't mean to scare you, Evan.  Just wanted to know how the flatworms  project was coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fine I guess. It's been kind of  crazy lately with my mom coming up,  so I haven't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Who can think of  worms when your libido's in full  swing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan shrugs and forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't drop the ball, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you down, Professor  Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter waves to another student and her parents and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter clears the dishes away from Evan and Andrea's ta

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL ANDREA
dialogues.text: Her hair now has gray streaks. As she signs for the bill, she leans over and kisses Evan on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, mom. People will talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. I'm just so proud  of you. You've got the highest grades  in all of your classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Da -- Jason --- get good grades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Please. He got straight A's without  ever touching a book. That was the  one area where his memory never failed  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma? Did he ever say that he figured  out a way to recall a lost memory  years after he blacked it out for  the first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just weird with him being  such a brain and all, I just wondered  if he was ever able to remember stuff  he'd forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he was around your age... almost  exactly your age. He said he figured  out a trick to remember the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan tries not to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell if they were real  memories or just phantoms. You know,  he might only have thought he actually  remembered them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, just before it got so bad  that he had to be committed, he said  that he could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What could he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's nothing. He was far  too sick by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods, but something gnaws beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan hastily hunts through his journals, tearing up the r looking for a certain book. Thumper, lying on his bed, qu watches Evan with growing concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) I never wanted to be in the movie  anyway and it was cold so I wanted  to wear my clothes but Mr. Miller  took his shirt off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! I need quiet for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you stupid or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shucks, I dunno. But maybe there's a  reason why you've repressed the one  day when some old lecher had you in  your tighty whities, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper begins scanning the journal entry. A bitter laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. I'd think twice about  this. You could wake up a lot more  fucked up than you are now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the journal back to Evan. Evan opens it and begi reading it silently. His hands begin to tremble and he slams the book shut in  defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, looking haggard and frail, wipes the greasy hair fr his eyes and punches the accelerator. His teeth are clenc and he hammers his fist on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan pulls into a parking lot of a country diner. He eyes piece of paper with an address scrawled on it and gets ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A run-down greasy spoon. Filled with a number of TOWNIES TRUCKERS. The place is stale with cigarette smoke and app decorated in grime motif. Evan is about to enter when he spots Kayleigh coming out the kitchen with a tray full of food. Kayleigh, now twenty, looks pale and sickly thin. She ban her hip on the swinging door and an order of food crashes the floor. Her BOSS stares back in aggravation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get through one goddamned day  without you breaking something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean the order. She is humiliated and Evan leans back against pay phone so that she can't see him watching her. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen, a CUSTOMER pin her ass. Evan closely studies her reaction to the offense She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for customer. Evan backs out uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat as sh exits. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's startled at f but eventually recognizes him. A smile flickers across he face and she allows herself to be hugged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Evan! I never thought I'd see  you again. How've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, comme si, comme ca, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Evan. I don't know. It's been a  long time. Fill me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to State now. Things are  going okay. I guess. Mom's good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh nods and they walk down the street. She reaches  into her pocket, pulls out a pack of smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (declining) Not since we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've stopped a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a long drag) They kept him in juvy for a few years.  Now he works over at Dale's Autobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still live with your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face is betrayed by a slight tick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I emancipated myself when I was  fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That must've taken some courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you remember my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
