dialogues.text: Couldn't you have moved in with your  mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) She had a new family. Not enough  space for me. Said I should have  moved in with her when we were kids.  But... whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Kayleigh, the reason I  came back to town was to talk to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightening) Me? Are you kidding? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when I was a kid I had all  these blackouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, lately some of the memories  have begun to come back and I'd kinda  like to talk to you about one of  them in particular. It'd be a big  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sure. I'll try to remember.  Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were kids. Your dad was making  a movie. Robin Hood or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) What do you want to know, Evan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... did he... what happened  in the basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) Is that why you came all the way  back? To ask a lot of stupid questions  about Robin Hood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I think something really bad  might've happened to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a point to any of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's features shift from inquisitory to tenderness. He  steps closer to Kayleigh and softly strokes her face. She flinches at first, but remains in the same spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened, it wasn't our  fault. You know we couldn't have  stopped it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Kayleigh. This may sound like  bullshit coming from a guy who hasn't  spoken to you in seven years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves her face away from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were seven years old and  there's nothing you could've done to  deserve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face collapses and she turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defeated) Just shut up, Evan. You're wasting  your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't hate yourself just because  your dad's a twisted freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you trying to convince, Evan?!  You come all the way out here to  stir up my shit just because you had  a bad memory!? You want me to cry on  your shoulder and tell you that  everything's all better now? Well  fuck you, Evan! Nothing's gonna be  all better! Okay?! Nothing ever gets  better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh runs, stops and turns back to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was so wonderful, Evan, why  didn't you ever call me? Why'd you  leave me here to rot?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and runs away. Evan looks sick with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few GREEKS play frisbee and talk trash. Evan, tired and depressed, sits on the lawn nearby, fingering the new bur scar on his belly. Contemplating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters his dorm. He ignores Thumper, who sits on Eva bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. He chokes out message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some dude left a message for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan puts a towel under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can smell it all the way in the  bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan hits "play" on the answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (male voice) Hi, Evan, this is Professor Carter.  Just wondered why you didn't hand in  your essay this afternoon. I was a  bit concerned. Call me to schedule a  make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. Thumper offers Evan a magnified frown of disapprova

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (male voice) What did you say to my sister  motherfucker?! Last night she cried  on the phone for over an hour to me. (enraged breathing) She said you came and saw her last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper coughs accidentally, tips the bong over on Evan's bed. Reacting quickly, he grabs a towel from under the do and wipes off Evan's comforter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tommy; cont'd) She... she fucking killed herself  tonight. She's dead. (beat) And so are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP. Evan stares dumbstruck at the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, bad news, bro. I don't think  this is gonna come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, dressed in black, gets out of his car at the edge o the cemetery. A small cluster of friends and family gathe at the grave. Evan grabs a bouquet of roses and begins wa to the grave. When he suddenly spots Mr. Miller and Tommy Evan's hands tense up into fists. He becomes weak in the  knees and stops walking. After an uncomfortable moment of standing still, he retreats to his car and watches the  ceremony from the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the mourners are filing away. Evan exits his and walks to the deserted grave. He drops the roses on th casket and turns to make sure nobody is watching. Evan reaches into his pocket and pulls out a sheet of pap He unfolds it and leaves it on her gravesite:

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S DIARY
dialogues.text: "I'll come back for you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a weighty decision and gets up. He hastily hunts through his journals, looking for a certain book. Evan opens his journal marked "Age 7". He plops on his be and starts writing sideways in the margins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been said that a person's life  is little more than the sum of his  experiences. If that's true, then  I'm not sure I know who I am anymore. (beat) I definitely never knew Kayleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the page and begins reading the journal. As he m the entry to himself, the resonance of an older man's voi seems to REVERBERATE throughout the room and the WORLD be his head FAINTLY VIBRATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller plays with his camera and the kids are excited about playing Robin Hood in a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up moron. Now get in your costume  Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan slowly nods and begins to strip out of his clothes. Miller takes a quick peek at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an idea. Let's go downstairs,  it'll look more like a dungeon down  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller puts the camera on a tripod in the basement.  Kayleigh and Evan sit on folding chairs in front of the  camera. Tommy stands at the top of the basement stairs,  looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tommy) What did I say about keeping that  door closed, stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wanna see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna see my fist in about  two seconds unless you do what I  tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy sulks and closes the door. Mr. Miller lowers his vo and speaks to Evan and Kayleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in this part of the story, Robin  Hood just married Maid Marian and  they have to kiss and stuff like  grown-ups do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh giggles and covers her mouth with her hand. Evan looks skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So take your clothes off Kayleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh stops giggling. Evan says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, like when you take a bath.  Don't make a deal out of it. You  too, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller gets behind the lens. The room is dead silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Who silently opens the door at the top of the basement st and watches with horror. Evan's face is flushed with rage. He walks behind Kayleig and cups his hands tightly around her ears. She can't hea anything now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for you to stand where the  hell I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer, fuckbag. This is the  very moment of your reckoning. In  the next thirty seconds you're going  to open one of two doors. The first  door will forever traumatize your  own flesh and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mature speech seems completely surreal coming from a  seven-year old. Mr. Miller looks around the room as if he the butt of some sick joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned disbelief) What's happened to -- How are you  doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice rising) It'll change your daughter from a  beautiful child into an empty shell  whose only concept of trust was  betrayed by her own sick pedophile  father. Ultimately, it'll lead to  her suicide. Nice work, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) Who -- who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan impatiently waves the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say you're being closely  watched, George. Your other option  is to get your porn off the rack and  treat Kayleigh like... oh, let's say  like how a loving father treats his  daughter. Sound okay to you, Papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking) ...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen close then, fuckbag. You screw  up again and I swear I'll flat out  castrate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impact of the last sentence isn't lost on Mr. Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan leans over to whisper in Kayleigh's ear. Kayleigh st at the floor, then looks up at her father and shivers. Kayleigh looks into Evan's eyes for support. Evan nods go on. His confidence brings a boldness to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever touch me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh summons her own new courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cold. And I'm putting on my  clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he leaves to pick up her clothes, Evan grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you need to do is discipline  your son Tommy, because the kid's  one sadistic pup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding at the top of the basement stairs, Tommy recoils i horror and picks up one of his sister's dolls and begins  twisting the head back and forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broad smile lines Evan's face as he slowly wakes up fro his slumber. He suddenly grabs his head as if suffering f a pounding migraine.

dialogues.speaker: SWIRLING MEMORIES
dialogues.text: Quick cuts and flashes of Evan and Kayleigh growing older she seems more carefree now, full of life and less self-  conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan pulls Kayleigh around in a little red wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh play in a tub of balls in the playroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh pushes Evan on a tire swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, glaring at Evan, thrashes the Teen Punk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning sack in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK FLASH of the U-Haul driving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At thirteen, Kayleigh spunkily hops off a GREYHOUND BUS a runs into Evan's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still thirteen, Evan peddles his bike by his new house,  Kayleigh riding on the handlebars. More memory flashes of Evan and Kayleigh throughout the t years, they grow up as lovers now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh have romantic picnic on a rowboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh watch the sunrise after senior prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the memory assault is over. Evan groans in pain a blood trickles from his nose. An arm reaches over and touches his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan whips around to see Kayleigh watching him. Not only Kayleigh alive, but she's a ravishing beauty. Evan lurche back from the shock of seeing Kayleigh and falls to the f She sees Evan's nose bleed and her eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Evan. You're bleeding!  Look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, still stunned, can do little but stare from the flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (transfixed by her) Jesus, Kayleigh, you're... (looks around) Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (purring) Mmmm... You give good compliment.  Clean up and come back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands in the middle of her bedroom, surrounded by sor plaques and pink preppy decor. Evan, hardly able to take his eyes off her as she hands h a tissue. He reaches for his clothes at the foot of the b and comes up with a Greek-lettered fraternity sweatshirt brown suede jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... where are my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are your clothes, silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan frowns with distaste, grabs a towel and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sink, Evan washes the blood off his face and looks his reflection in the mirror. A nearby shower SHUTS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too amazing! Un-fucking-real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could get so excited about  a nose bleed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan turns around and sees Gwen, one of the sorority brat from the bar, exit the shower naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops. Sorry. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan blushes and turns back to the mirror through which G dries herself with a towel while staring flirtatiously ba at Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you were with those assholes  who threw popcorn at Thumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan holds his temple in pain as another memory comes to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your name is... Gwen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Evan. Lay off the blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pats his ass and exits the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh, wearing a long skirt and tight red sweater, cat the eye of every guy on campus. She and Evan stroll arm i arm through the quad. Somehow, the world seems brighter now. Even the colors se more vibrant when compared to the somewhat grimmer world  we've known. MANY STUDENTS wave to Evan and call his name. He can't  remember all their names but it's kinda cool being the BM Evan takes a long look at her and becomes curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, don't go freaking out on me  over this, but do you remember when  your dad first got his video camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I remember he had one... but  he, like, put it away after the first  day. Why would that freak me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. (goofy smile) Just being weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh playfully sweeps her leg around to kick him on t ass, then smiles as if a ghost must have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a goofus. See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh gives him a big unexpected kiss and walks away.  After a moment of wow, Evan runs off to class himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan inserts his last quarter into the lobby pay phone an dials a telephone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Come on, Mom, be there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Andrea's voice) Andrea, (Evan's voice) Evan, (a strange, older  man's voice) And Chuck, (all three) Aren't home right now. You know what  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off-guard) Hi, Mom and, uh, Chuck. Just calling  to say hi and well, call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan hangs up the phone, then checks his watch. No, wrist At that moment, Thumper passes Evan in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper! What time is it, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper eyes this strange preppy kid with distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whasamatter? Lost your Rolex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, frat boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper walks away, leaving Evan dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan runs into the lecture hall and gets in line behind o STUDENTS who are taking No. 2 pencils from a box on Profe Carter's desk. Evan hears PEOPLE he cannot see calling his name. Somehow it's more creepy than cool. The Professor makes a loud  announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, everyone! Only two weeks  until your science projects are due.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I still owe you an essay from last  week. Is there any way I could get  an extension?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Evan Treborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer's 'no', Mr. Treborn. Now  take a seat. The exam's about to  begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan walks up the aisle and takes a seat. As he sits down someone puts his ARM menacingly around Evan's throat. Evan flinches, turns around and sees Hunter, the frat guy Thumper assaulted the other night at Dirty Hank's bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, asshole. I didn't  lay a hand on you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, you're hysterical. You study  for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) We'll find out soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunter surreptitiously hands Evan a cheat-sheet to the ex Evan's face brightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding. Are these the  answers?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, Evan, on the D.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it lower) Thanks. Wow. Hey, I want to do  something really special for Kayleigh  tomorrow. If I said I needed some  help from you and the brothers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say blow me. Get the pledges to  do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods and smiles as exams are passed down his row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Kayleigh have just finished having sex. She seem incredibly satisfied, but he looks slightly uncomfortable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, that was good. Where'd  you learn all those new tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it didn't feel... weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you call multiple orgasms  weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She giggles and snuggles into him. He's grateful for her  affection, but still looks uneasy. The PHONE RINGS and he automatically answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence on the other end. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Evan hangs up, he and Kayleigh share a giggle and he  resumes snuggle position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it is about us  that makes us so perfect? Like,  looking back, whatever gave you the  nerve to sneak out and visit me after  I moved away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) As if my dad could've stopped me  from seeing you. What's he gonna do  to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan smiles to himself. And hugs her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we'll always be together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time she looks at him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the plan, right? Hell or  high water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in heaven, but plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just making sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pledges of Theta Chi busily gather around Evan, their clothes covered in dirt, food and what might be vomit. Evan, now dressed like his usual self, bangs a wooden spo on a metal salad bowl that a poor THETA CHI PLEDGE wears a hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order, order. So all you rushes know  what you've got to do for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him) Pledges, Sir Brother Evan, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pledges, rushees, same difference.  Now this is a one-time deal. You do  all this for me and I'll never give  you shit again. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buzz of excitement runs through the pledges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's peaceful now. Evan covers Kayleigh's eyes with his h as he leads her through the attic hallways. Both are dres to the nines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, where are you  taking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wooden door to the rooftop swings open, revealing Kay and Evan. Kayleigh is dazzled by what she sees: The entire roof is decorated with fairy-lights, Chinese  lanterns and hundreds upon hundreds of candles. And elega romantic table for two awaits them, flanked by twelve FOR DRESSED SERVANTS (previously seen pledges) who respectful stare ahead with the utmost class. Two pledges immediately pull out two chairs and stand by. Kayleigh applauds and laughs with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say. It's  beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she takes a step toward the table -- FLOWER PETALS sho down on her. She looks up to see TWO MORE PLEDGES standin on ladders, delicately tossing pedals. Kayleigh looks overwhelmed as she sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing all this for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple math. When I woke up this  morning and saw your smile... I knew  that I wanted to spend the rest of  my life with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand reaches out to his and grabs it fiercely. Her ey tell him she feels the same way. A magical moment. And they lean into each other for a kiss so enchanted it  might as well be their first ever -- Hunter bolts up the stairs, two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been lookin' all over for you,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone trashed your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment's gone. Evan and Kayleigh exchange worried loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan runs down the front lawn to his car, the Honda parke at the bottom of the hill. His face collapses. Evan's car has been trashed and is surrounded by broken g The seats and tires have been slashed, the hood has been  mysteriously yanked off and the steering wheel sits on th roof. The most unnerving thing, however, is a SPIKED LEATHER DO COLLAR hangs off the rearview mirror. By now a crowd has gathered. Evan runs up to people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Did you see who did this? You see  anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will answer with anything more than a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably them Pika fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Kayleigh knows better. She stares at the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he get away with this?  Right in front of the goddamn frat  house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENIOR BROTHER angrily calls him from the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frat house? Hey man, would you call  your "country" a "cunt"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh shudders and Evan puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. He's probably watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan leads Kayleigh into his bedroom and shuts the door.  Evan can't help but look under the bed. No one. He then l the door, reaches into his desk and finds a tiny canister Pepper Spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I should have told  you he was released a few weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might'a been nice. (re: pepper spray) Like this is gonna do any good. Maybe  one of the frat guys has a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Evan. Don't even joke. He  wouldn't hurt you. He's just trying  to scare you away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking the cannister) Yeah, right. Tell that to Crockett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) It's not his fault, Evan. You knew  how bad he had it when we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me this Oprah-book club  bad upbringing shit, because you  turned out fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) My father never laid a hand on me.  It's like the prick saved it all up  for Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sits in silence for a moment, contemplating this.  Kayleigh's eyes plead for him to have compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, then. We'll let campus security  deal with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh and Evan walk through the all-but-deserted campu Evan seems especially paranoid. In the distance, some guy vomits loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... you've been acting kinda  strange, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You seem... different.  You make weird jokes. Your accents  changed. You don't even walk the  same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk differently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't put my finger on it, but  everything's a bit off. Even the  dinner tonight. It was beautiful,  but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I've been actin strange lately.  It's just that... I don't want  anything to happen to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy along the path gags loudly into the bushes. Kayle and Evan instinctively avert their eyes. Suddenly, Kaylei ears perk and she stops walking mid-stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Something's not right. Isn't  that your jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy, wearing Evan's brown suede jacket, suddenly spri to his feet, revealing his face for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy has grown in the last seven years. He has long, gre hair and some tattoos. He holds a TIRE THUMPER (a short,  steel bat for truckers) menacingly in his right hand. Evan stands frozen in fear, his hands rooted in his coat  pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone you sick fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this "us" shit. As if I was gonna  lay a hand on my own sister. You've  done nicely for yourself, Evan. Nice  friends, nice life, not to mention  you're fucking my sister. Not a bad  piece of ass if I say so myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Tommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, hey now, that was a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy takes a few practice swings with the tire thumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't enough that the whole world  loves you, but you had to take away  the last person on earth who didn't  think I was a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suppressing panic) No one thinks you're a piece of shit,  Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Evan. I believe you just said  "sick fuck."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy rushes Evan and bashes him with the tire thumper in the shoulder and ribs. Evan goes down. As Tommy prepares to bash his brains in,  Evan whips out the Pepper Spray and nails Tommy in the fa Tommy reels back in pain, covering his eyes with this fre hand. Evan struggles to his feet and circles around Tommy keeping a distance as he douses Tommy with Pepper Spray.  Kayleigh screams. Tommy blindly stumbles around, madly  swinging the tire thumper. Evan charges forward in an  uncontrollable rage, rips the weapon out of Tommy's hands and sprays a lethal dose of pepper spray into Tommy's ope mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, stop! You're gonna kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fucking maniac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan knocks Tommy down with the tire thumper. Kayleigh sc and tries to hold Evan back, but he easily wrestles free her. She runs to a blue streetlight on the quad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ruined Lenny's life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan kicks Tommy hard in the ribs. Kayleigh pushes a butt on the "Blue Light" lamp post and an ALARM WAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed Crockett -- (kicks him) Murdered that woman and her baby! (kicks again) And he's trying to kill me, Kayleigh!  He's trying to fucking kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan raises the tire thumper for a final attack and swing down OFF CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCH
dialogues.text: Evan sees what he's done and drops the weapon, horrified. Kayleigh sees what Evan's done to her brother. And stops  cold when she sees the damage to Tommy. Evan rushes toward her and she stumbles backwards, still  terrified by his rage, and skitters away from him in a  crablike fashion. SIRENS come racing to the quad. Evan looks away from Tomm limp body. Collapses to the ground and begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY VEHICLE pulls through the ominous metal gates the large state prison. The vehicle stops and Evan, along with nine other convicts, exit in leg and hand restraints

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, now wearing his standard issue inmate uniform, ente the General Population area of the prison. PRISONERS begi screaming vicious taunts and catcalls at the fresh batch new inmates. Evan tries to keep composed and walks toward his cell. Evan looks up to see one of the men leaning ove the second tier, KARL, a huge muscular con with tattoos o swastikas and other Nazi symbols on his arm, blows a kiss Evan and winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters a dimly lit cell plastered with pictures of J Christ and various Saints. Burning flames on open cans of shoe polish serve as candles to the large shrine. There is a stained bare mattress on the top bunk. Sitting the bottom bunk is CARLOS, 30s, a massive Hispanic convic covered with faded Indian ink jail tats of Christ in agon Carlos stares at Evan disinterestedly as Evan makes up hi bed on the top bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods glumly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best not bitch up. Wind up someone's  luggage that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Can you protect me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus himself couldn't make me take  on the Brotherhood. When they come,  just put your mind in another place,  man. Be somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUZZER SOUNDS. Carlos leaves the cell without another w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sets his tray down at a table filled with Carlos and some other INMATES. No sooner has he sat down to eat, do  eager forks reach onto his tray and steal his food. Carlo shrugs at Evan and offers him a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea sits across from Evan in the visitor's chamber. He hair is now bottle-blonde. Four inches of Plexiglas separ the two and they talk on monitored phones. Andrea, frazzl twirls an unlit cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I spoke to your new lawyer about  the appeal. He's sure he can get you  off on self-defense, so if you're  patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will I be in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. These things take time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Kayleigh doing? She all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea's look tells him to look for hope elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my journals, Mom? Did you  bring the ones I asked for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea nods, holding up two comp books. "AGE 7" and "AGE  13".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found these. The others are still  in storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Mom. I told you I need them  all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You'll get them, Evan. But I  think it's far more important to  focus on your case right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks as if he's about to disagree with her, but he  closes his mouth and placates her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mom. You're right. Just try to  tell Kayleigh I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And officer signals Evan and points to his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna lose you, kiddo. Promise  me you'll hang on, Ev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other and Evan slowly lowers the phone. hangs up, Andrea still pressing her phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan walks closely behind Carlos through a corridor, clut his journals. As he passes Karl, the Neo-Nazi, Karl reach over and firmly grabs Evan's crotch. Evan, totally violated, turns white with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit on my dick or blood on my knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan stands there, stunned, unable to react when -- Another Neo-Nazi, RICK, swats Evan's journals out of his  hands and onto the floor. Life springs back into Evan as rushes for the journals. He and Rick grab the journals at the same time. A minor tug of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! They're mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick tears them away, Evan coming up with only a few torn pages. Evan sees the damage and goes mental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan swings at Rick and misses. INMATES CHEER! It's on! R lunges for Evan, a brief and painful scuffle ensues, the  journals getting trampled. Suddenly -- The sounds of COCK RIFLES echo through the air. The fight stops instantly as Rick and Evan look up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER STATION. Officers aim rifles at the pair. From an upper tier, even more officers with more rifles. Their barrels sight directly at Evan. Rick steps away, qu to maliciously scoop up Evan's torn journals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be comin' for you tonight,  sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan catches his breath, then looks at the remaining few  pages on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters the cell with a few entry pages. He looks thr them. Nothing there. Evan nods depressed, then sees the page from his "Age 7"  journal, grabs Carlos' duct tape and tapes the page over bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, walking toward some White Supremacists, flinches  whenever the occasional INMATE brushes against him. Evan completely paranoid, waiting for an inevitable attack. Ka makes himself visible among them, holding a journal. He r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Evan's journal) Today I found my grandfather's death  certificate. He died in a nut house,  just like my father. Mom denies it,  but she thinks I'm gonna end up the  same way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Supremacists start laughing and calling "looney and "nut job." Evan rushes past them and they make chicke clucks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan and Carlos sit on BLEACHERS that overlook the other  prisoners working out. Evan closely watches Karl and Rick who stare daggers at h from across the yard. A SKINHEAD PASSES SOMETHING with a  white-taped handle to Karl but no officers seem to notice Evan slides closer to Carlos and stares at the Jesus Chri tattoos all over Carlos' back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're religious Carlos, you believe  that bit about "the Lord works in  mysterious ways?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I think he sent me to your  cell on purpose. For you to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I knew you were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't bullshitting. Jesus speaks  to me in my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos scoffs whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack of smokes says I can prove it  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos is suddenly interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan holds a tattered journal entry in his hand and finis up a conversation. Carlos looks dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when I'm out, I need you to watch  my face and hands closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to see the prison shrink,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their conversation stops when a convict rolls a mail cart by, Evan looking up expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Just not for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed, Evan turns back to Carlos. Holds up his jou entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me if anything weird  happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weirder than this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marks, scars, I dunno. Anything could  happen I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan studies the page.

dialogues.speaker: JOURNAL ENTRY
dialogues.text: "On Wednesday I got in trouble for a drawing that I didn' do. Mommy wont let me see it." Then as he starts reading it to himself, the bars behind almost imperceptibly VIBRATE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, seven, COMES TO in an old familiar place. WE are ba in Mrs. Boswell's first grade class. All of the children  draw colorful pictures. Evan sees some paper spindles sit on Mrs. Boswell's desk. As he heads over to them, Mrs. Bo firmly grabs his shoulders and steers him back to his own desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No monkey business, Evan. Sit still  and finish your drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, defeated, looks over at his blank piece of paper. H smiles mischievously, and grabs some colored pencils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great everyone! Just imagine  anything you want to be. There are  no limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon enough, an image emerges: Evan holding a knife, stan over a heap of several dead inmates Karl and Rick. When done, he sneaks over to Mrs. Boswell's desk, where t two paper spindles sit. The metal needles reach up and sk a number of paper notes and messages. Evan looks over to see Mrs. Boswell holding up his drawin horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musically) Oh, Mrs. Boswelllllllll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over in time to see Evan using all of his seven year old strength to WHIP his hands down toward the spind The moment before his palms reach them there's a brief in where SOUNDSCAPES COLLIDE and the world behind him VIBRAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to as ECHOES OF SCREAMING CHILDREN FADE. Alert slowly creeps back up on him as he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sweet Jesus. It's true. It's a  miracle! A miracle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks up to see Carlos staring at him with reverence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands. The stigmata!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks to see two scars in the center of each palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see? What did it look  like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Signs of the Lord. They just appeared  out of nowhere. I thought you were  loco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos simply stares at him, awestruck, and hands over a of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nervously approaches. A CREW of Aryans block his pat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aryans laugh, make discrete eye contact with Karl, wh grins and signals to let Evan pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl and Rick wait expectantly as Evan nervously enters.  They say nothing, relishing the fearful silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I'm new to all this but I think  I get how things work. You gotta  join a gang or else end up dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it sure ain't gonna fucking be  with no niggers or spics. So how do  we do this? You gotta work your way  up, and I'm the new guy. (looking ill) So... should I... I mean, do I suck  your dicks right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl and Rick exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your blood pure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) I ain't no fucking kike if that's  what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands. All muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what you got. And watch  the fucking teeth or you'll be leaving  without 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods reluctantly and peacefully drops to his knees.  Karl and Rick lower their pants to their ankles. Evan loo miserable, about to do the deed when -- CARLOS bulldozes  past the Aryans into the room, slamming Karl into the wal and jamming a shank into Karl's crotch! Rick instantly charges Carlos, but trips on the pants aro his ankles. Evan, anticipating Rick's fall, stomps Rick's face before snatching his journals from Karl's shelf. Evan frantically flips through them, hunting for somethin as the other WHITE SUPREMACISTS charge the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos drops Karl's writhing body to the floor and presse his girth against the cell door. Evan locates an entry and concentrates on the words just the other supremacists force the door open -- Evan focuse on the words. Chanting quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took the woods behind the junkyard  just to make sure we wouldn't bump  into Tommy. We hadn't seen the smoke  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORDS from the entry begin to SHIMMER. REVERBERANT SOUNDS BARKING break the sound barrier and the image of Aryans  storming the cell behind him become a FRENETIC BLUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, thirteen again, comes to in the woods. Evan stumble at first, then rights himself. He seems strangely exhilar A sinister victory smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rot in hell you fucking animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh and Lenny, walking by his side, do a double take Evan shrugs "just kidding" and looks around, getting his  bearings. He whips his hand out and stops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Before we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly notices Kayleigh who now no longer looks an  awkward and unkempt tomboy, but rather a vibrant and femi young girl. Whereas her clothes were loose and unflatteri before, she is now radiant and wears fashionable styles. Evan remembers his mission and darts over to a JUNK PILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need something to cut open the  sack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh and Lenny stare at him, concerned for his sanity Evan roots through the trash until he finds something: a  razor sharp piece of metal about two feet long. Evan offe it to Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to take this, Lenny.  Today's your day of atonement. I  know how guilty you feel about that  woman and her baby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan. Stop it. It's not the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Now's the only time! (to Lenny) Today you get a chance to redeem  yourself. Start over with a clean  slate. Tabula rasa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate; to Lenny) Please. If you've ever trusted me  before, trust me on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan places the metal shard in Lenny's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny slowly follows Evan as he bolts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan groans on the ground, writhing. Tommy's voice hitche eyes watering from pent up frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me good, Evan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you want. You don't  want me to ever see Kayleigh again,  fine. Just let Crockett go. Besides,  you kill him now and they'll stick  you in juvy for sure. And I know  you'd never leave your sister alone  with your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's words hit home and Tommy's anger slowly dissipates look of understanding passes between them. Gratitude, eve Tommy looks at the sack and begins to untie it. Lenny com screaming from nowhere like a bat out of hell! With all o the force he can muster, he jams the metal shard all the through Tommy's throat! Tommy clutches his throat, gagging in blood. Evan surveys the scene in shock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck, Lenny, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny drops to the floor, Indian style, wipes the dirt in his hands and freezes up completely. Kayleigh wakes up an SCREAMS when she sees blood spurt from Tommy's throat. Meanwhile, Crockett escapes from the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, silhouetted by the sky, seems to vibrate violently if operating a jack-hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to in a familiar place. His original college d ONLY BACKWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits upright in bed and takes in his surroundings. Whe suddenly, Evan clutches his head in severe pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color memories of Kayleigh's sorority fade to BLACK and W and dissipate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memories of Evan's vandalized car fade to BLACK and WHITE and dissipate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces of Karl and Rick all turn grainy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As new images of THUMPER become more BRILLIANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new image overwhelms the others: Lenny, 13, with dark,  soulless eyes wearing a straight-jacket in a padded room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's eyes roll back in his head. He shakes uncontrollab and blood pours from his nose. Thumper opens the door, sees Evan convulsing and jumps ba in horror. He scans the hallways for assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call 9-1-1!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan lies on an examining table undergoing another series CAT-scans. The machines are now state of the art and the room has been redecorated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea nervously chews her fingernails as she watches Dr. Redfield post CAT-scan results on the light box. A young  nurse pushes Evan, in a wheelchair, into the doctor's off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, doc. What's the damage? How  much time have I got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little complicated. I haven't  seen results exactly like these  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Not even with my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield and Andrea exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, these tests weren't  available twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield points to the CAT-scan slides, specifically, the outer lining of Evan's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we're finding most of  the hemorrhaging. The outer lining  of the cerebral cortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) Lemme guess. Would that be where the  memories are stored?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield stares ahead. Transfixed by the slides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anything like this.  I've compared these to the ones taken  last year, and there's evidence of  severe hemorrhaging and massive neural  reconstruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea stares at him blankly. Evan impatiently "pops whee in the wheel chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean for Evan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrea) He's saying it's like forty years  worth of new memories have been jammed  in my brain since last year. Overload  city. 'Sat about the gist of it,  doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield nods, awed by Evan's effortless interpretati Evan springs out of the wheelchair and stretches his legs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andrea) Mind if I wait in the car? The  lighting here bugs my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea nods. Evan shakes Dr. Redfield's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's nice seeing you again.  But you know, people to see, things  to read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea shoots Dr. Redfield an apologetic look. Evan heads out the door, accidentally knocking Dr. Redfield's jacket the floor. He shrugs apologetically and re-hangs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the office, Evan inspects Dr. Redfield's KEYS and attached SECURITY CARD and smiles. Evan covertly winds hi through the maze of corridors, careful not to be seen by staff. He finally sees a wing marked "CRIMINALLY INSANE". Evan l around to make certain he's not being watched, then uses security card to open the door. He looks in every room of the wing until he finds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan unlocks the door and is moved by what he sees. Lenny is strapped onto a metal bed, his arms and legs in  tight leather restraints. The dark five o'clock shadow an his malicious grin radiate evil. His black and haunting eyes personify hate and murderous  intent. Lenny seems neither surprised or happy to see Evan. That if he's aware of Evan's presence at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything you need? Anything  I can get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Lenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the models, man? Bet I  can get you a shitload of models up  in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. Not even a glance in his direction. Evan s and gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Lenny. Just wanted to say "hi".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan turns around to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew the whole time, didn't you? (Evan spins around) When you put the blade in my hand,  you knew something big was going to  happen. Didn't you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jaw dropped) Y... yes. I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny's eyes seethe with hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should be where I am. You  should be where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan backs away, face guilt-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters his dormroom (where everything's backwards),  reaches under his bed and is relieved to find the journal marked "AGE 7".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is ignored by several Theta Chi pledges as he plops  himself by a tree and hunts through his journal to find t entry from when he was seven and visited Jason at Sunnyva

dialogues.speaker: JOURNAL ENTRY
dialogues.text: "Today I get to mete my father. His name is Jason and he crazy. I hope he lets me call him dad." Evan takes a calming breath and begins reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if reciting a  mantra) Today I get to meet my father. His  name is Jason and he is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan gets some strange looks, but continues. As he does, trees and frisbee-playing students behind him VIBRATE and SHUDDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-year old Evan comes to during the time he first met his father, Jason. Jason waits patiently for young Evan to finish his senten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You looked like you  were somewhere else for a second  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jason, I need some fast answers  if I'm ever gonna fix what I've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is completely thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was praying this curse would have  ended with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it didn't. And now I need info  to make things right again and you're  the only one who can give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) There is no "right". When you change  who people are, you destroy who they  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's to say you can't make things  better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason seems extremely upset to hear Evan say this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't play God, son. It must end  with me. Just by being here, you may  be killing your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I'll send you a postcard  when I've made everything perfect  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason launches himself across the table, shackles and all and grabs hold of Evan's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jason looks down at us, frothing at the mouth, there's trick of the light where Jason's head seems to VIBRATE ag the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's hands instinctively reach for his throat, then he  realizes his surroundings. Heartbroken, he shuts the jour and stands up shakily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan eats in the same diner where Kayleigh used to work. he eats, his arm sits in front of his plate, protectively Guarding his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get out, didja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his arm) Nothing. Just that my brother did a  stint in the pen and he used to eat  like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I come from a big family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meant no offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None taken. Hey, uh, does Kayleigh  Miller still work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Sorry. Never heard of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan slowly walks up the driveway, which is now a dilapid mess. Garbage litters the front lawn and paint chips rot the sides of the house. Inside, Mr. Miller yells at someo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut the hell up already! Can't  a man get a little goddman peace in  his own home! (Evan rings doorbell) Oh, for Christ's sake, now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller opens the door and sees Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't suppose you're here to sell  cookies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a blur, Evan grabs Mr. Miller's shirt and violently sh him through the house and into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good guess, fuckbag. (off Miller's startled  face) Remember me now? We had a great chat  once when I was seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller goes slack, his eyes wide with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One question, fuckbag. Where can I  find your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan walks past some junkies and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan steps over some passed out bodies that litter the ha of an incredibly seedy motel. The kind with hourly rates. knocks on a door. Kayleigh, now haggard, strung-out junkie, opens the door immediately the contempt for Evan grows in her eyes. She  puts out an expression of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought you were my eight  o'clock. Make it fast, I'm expecting  someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, too. Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around, waves him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew you were coming I'd have  cleaned the stains off the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dirty and sparse, excepting charred-bottom sp yellowed cotton balls and brown-spotted squares of tin fo Evan doesn't hesitate to sit on the "soiled" bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan can't speak. His eyes begin to water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just needed to see... a friendly  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His sincerity touches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, time is money, Evan. So you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan reaches for his wallet and throws it on her dresser. Kayleigh eyes the wallet. But makes no move to pick it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I can spare ten minutes  for an old friend, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears fall freely from Evan's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's tricks? Sorry, occupational  humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. You can drop it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry again) Oh, I'm sorry. Does my line of work  make you uncomfortable, precious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just that you need to hurt me  with it. I've been where you've been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottom. When you're just a piece  of meat waiting for the next attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh watches Evan silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe me. I mean,  people always say, "You wouldn't  believe me", but in this case, it's  not even worth trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen some sickening shit. I  don't blink twice anymore, especially  in your case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're... different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question. Just a  little one that's been gnawing at me  for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bridge. How did you know that  Tommy had your dog? That was no  fucking hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when I was a kid and  I had those blackouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan continues and Kayleigh listens with a mixture of int interest and matched skepticism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh finishes a plateful of food at a busy diner. She lights up an after-dinner smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Evan, I don't believe  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought you would. That's  why I've never bothered to tell a  soul until now, and why I never will  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only person you've told?  That's a great line. Does that make  other girls swoon? Do they actually  eat up this bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't give a shit if you believe  me or not, and frankly I'm too tired  to prove it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? There's proof now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired) Shit. I dunno. How would I know about  the twin moles on your inner thigh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with fifty bucks could tell  you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then forget that. How about... you  prefer the smell of a skunk to  flowers, you hate cilantro because  for reasons unknown to you, it reminds  you of your step-sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! And when you orgasm, your toes  go numb. I'm sure your clientele  aren't privy to that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh tries to conceal the surprise in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I didn't leave you there to  rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh flinches as if her should had been invaded, then her eyes fill with distrust and contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one major hole in your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no fuckin' way on this planet  or any other that I was in some  fuckin' sorority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens Evan's wallet and leaves a twenty on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want your wallet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think I'll need it where I'm  going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off to change everyone's life again,  is that it? Maybe this time you'll  pop up in some mansion while I wind  up in Tijuana doing the donkey act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm over it. Whenever I try to help  anyone it all turns to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't give up now, Slick. You've  already done so much for me. Hell,  why don't you go back in time and  save Mrs. Halpern and her baby. Then  maybe Lenny wouldn't freak out and  ruin my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and puts on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here's one! Go back when I'm  seven and fuck me in front of Daddy's  handicam, you know, straighten me  out a bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses his wallet over her shoulder at him and leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters his familiar looking dorm and hears the famil sounds of Thumper having sex with another naked GOTHIC CO ED. On Evan's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, dude. Just figured it'd be  okay with you bein' sick and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's temper flares and he picks up a chair and SMASHES against a wall above Thumper's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumper and the co-ed quickly cover themselves in the bla and leave. Alone in the room, Evan looks under his bed an breathes a sigh of relief to see all of his journals are  intact. He sifts through them again. He finally finds the passage he needs. Something catches the corner of Evan's  eyes and he turns to examine it. To the left of Thumper's Buddha statuette sits a large VO CANDLE that bears a portrait of Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humble) Lord give me the strength and guidance  I need to set things right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he begins reading a passage to himself, SOUNDS ECHO  backward at us from another time and place. And the entir ROOM SHIMMERS around him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to as he, Kayleigh, Lenny and Tommy -- all thi watch Mrs. Halpern carry her baby back to the mailbox acr the street with intense anticipation. Evan suddenly comes life and makes himself visible, running across the street shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, stay back! Don't go near the  mailbox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Halpern, startled, stares at the young kid skeptical as she absently continues toward the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, woman! Get the hell back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny comes running across the street to Evan's aid, and  Tommy shrugs and follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bomb in the mailbox. Get  away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, still running, cringes to hear Lenny's stupid  confession and rolls his eyes at the situation. Evan posi himself between Mrs. Halpern and the mailbox, frantically waving his hand at her to stay back, because she's STILL  COMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll save you lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy takes a running dive at Mrs. Halpern, perhaps a bit too hard, and sends her and the baby to the pavement, hur but no major injuries. Seeing things are safe, Evan backs away from the mail --

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The blast is deafening! Evan's body is hurled backwards  dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to back in his dorm, the same posters are on t wall, the sheets are the same. Even the familiar sounds o Thumper having sex under the covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you two to beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's face falls as he hears a familiar voice, but not  Thumper's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Hey, sorry, man. We wake you  up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is confused by Lenny's presence, but smiles to himse and shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's cool. (re: Lenny's okay) Really cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan yawns, bringing his hand to his mouth, but there's n hand. No arm, really, either. Just two FLESHY STUMPS! Evan bolts upright in bed and stares down at his amputati

dialogues.speaker: A FLOOD OF MEMORIES ASSAULT HIM
dialogues.text: We see countless and brief image flashes of Evan growing from the age of thirteen with NO ARMS, and requiring a  WHEELCHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's la as Lenny pushes the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan celebrates his 14th birthday and blows out the candl Andrea, Kayleigh, Tommy and Lenny all clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy pushes Evan to church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan screams as blood pours from his nose. Lenny is out o bed at once to help him... as is KAYLEIGH! (Now beautiful and natural looking).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny and Kayleigh, as teens, sit together with Evan at t far end of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks on longingly as Lenny and Kayleigh become love in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire. Evan sips from a BEER CAP as Lenny and Kaylei make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's in agony as Kayleigh opens a series of dorm doors Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries pair of prosthetic arms in her hands. Evan moans and tries to rub his temple with his stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get you to Sunnyvale.  You're having one of your famous  hemorrhages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Take me back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, tough guy, no can do. Your  mother would kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan launches his body forward and spills clumsily out of the wheelchair. Lenny must halt in order not to crush Eva As Evan writhes about on the floor, his legs paralyzed, a CROWD GATHERS. Evan focuses on Lenny, but it's hard to ignore the crowd  that titters and snickers in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me back, Lenny! (teeth clenched) You owe me that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you geeks looking at? Must  be nice to be so goddamned perfect,  huh? Fucking losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd breaks up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's calm now. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair  around the quad. Evan now wears prosthetic arms. Random P call out to Lenny. He's extremely popular in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sup, Sheila! We missed you at the  party! Don't even think I'm giving  you my lab notes either! Think I  like getting up for "eight thirty's"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny pushes Evan past Thumper and Cricket. Their convers stops and they stare at their feet as Evan gets wheeled b Evan boils to be treated as if he were non-existent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan spins around in fear. He sees Tommy, clean-cut, and  handing out flyers in front of a banner that reads "Campu Crusade for Christ." Tommy seems good-natured now, workin hard and soliciting names for his list. He looks up as Ev rolls along and his eyes brighten to see Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what you said, man! We're  pooling our student funds with Hillel  House and we're going to have an  Awareness Dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh goody, nothing like spinning my  chair around to a techno mix of Hava  Nagila til I puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy frowns and exchanges glances with Lenny, who shrugs and nods back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we should be getting to class  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. What's the point of Psych  now? Tomorrow I could wake up as  some dirt farmer in Bangladesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another exchanged glance. Kayleigh looks at Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a stroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan allows Kayleigh to roll him away from the others. To the very spot where Evan once killed Tommy. Evan stares at his prosthetic hand which he can "magicall will to open, close, open, close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Tommy's really into this Jesus  kick, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how spiritual he's gotten  ever since he saved Mrs. Halpern and  Katie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saved Mrs. Halpern? Please, the  twisted fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh, now by a bench. Stops and sits. As she casually uses her foot to turn his chair to face her, she pulls ou granola bar and hands it to him. His prosthetic hand crushes it. It crumbles to dust. She  seems more confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: prosthetic arms) Yeah, I think I gotta get these fixed  or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans into him, gently feeding him her remaining bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh? Do you ever think about  "us?" I mean, wonder if it could  ever have been different between the  two of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Evan, why not? You were the  first person I really ever cared  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why when I was little I never  went to live with my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeding another bite) When my folks split, they gave me  and Tommy a choice who we wanted to  live with. I couldn't stand my dad,  but I knew if I moved to my mom's  I'd never see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew that. So then you still  sometimes think of us... together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crossed my mind from time to  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well a lot of things cross my mind.  I've always been a fast thinker, Ev.  I can play out the movie of our entire  lives in under a second. Boom -- we  fall in love -- get married -- two  kids, your keen analytical insight  matched to my generous nature --  kids grow old as do we, relatively  stable relationships, matching burial  plots, the whole bit. It took a lot  longer to spit out than to imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you think it might have worked  out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? But that's not how things  wound up. I'm with Lenny, Lenny's  your friend. And there it ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into his eyes and shrugs almost apologetically. Tears streak down Evan's face as he speaks in a pleading  tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it make any difference if I  told you that no one could possibly  love anyone as much as I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. E turns to see Lenny waving her over. She puts her hand on  Evan's shoulder, stands and goes to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny kissing Kayleigh. In painful slo-mo. Evan turns awa utterly heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's stump turns on a BATHTUB FAUCET.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Evan, fully clothed, lies in a bathtub that's filling wit water. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped ove The water rises past his mouth, to his nostrils -- Evan m his peace and takes a final breath. And the water spills over the side of the tub. All Evan c do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. A beat. Then the door opens. TOMMY ENTERS. Immediately sizing up the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to put the toaster on the  edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy casually turns off the water, then pops open the DR The water level lowers to Evan's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you, Kayleigh and Lenny like  toast. And that's really all that  matters now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
