dialogues.text: Tommy feels Evan's anguish and plops his ass on the wet f by the tub. He lays his head onto Evan's shoulder. Evan bristles at first, but finally gives in to his hatre ultimately resting his own head against Tommy's. Taking t comfort offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you changed. Visiting hours  are almost up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy rolls Evan through a quiet hospital corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) What, did mom get transferred again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy frowns, confused, then rolls Evan into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan is startled to see Andrea hooked up to several IV's, oxygen tank and a respirator. Several oxygen hoses connec to a tracheotomy tube. Tommy smiles and kisses Andrea on the cheek. She tousles hair in return. Evan can hardly speak. As Tommy begins to wheel Evan's ch closer to Andrea's bedside, Andrea utters a faint whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking. Good. Kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan eyes her MEDICAL CLIPBOARD as he's wheeled by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Lung cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mrs. T. He's been out of sorts  lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea flinches to hear this. Evan stares at her, eyes wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... You started chain smoking  after I blew myself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan suddenly seems sick with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a way to fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need the entry about the  blockbuster. Wait, shit, no arms. I  never even got the chance to write  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of recognition registers in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Evan... different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just going through some tough  times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. Don't cry. I can change this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll go check out the chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're. Acting. Like your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mom. Just 'cause Dad was my  age when he started going crazy  doesn't mean that I'm nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How. Did you. Know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me that on Parents' Weekend.  Remember? Wait, that wasn't me. Or  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uses her left hand to pinch off the air to her oxygen tube and forces herself to speak in a sick, GRAVELY manne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just. Like. Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm gonna get you out  of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes a lever and the mechanical wheelchair rolls its out of the room. Andrea forces her loudest raspy scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him. Stop him. Stop him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny tears through old cardboard boxes in Evan's closet. Evan watches nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you even packed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom packed for me. I think she  sent everything I ever owned. So  we'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's jun on the floor. Old report cards, books, toys and photo alb fall on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. AG 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need it for? I don't get  you lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duly noted. Now I'm gonna ask you  for one last favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. I need to concentrate on the  blockbuster if I'm gonna destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Destroy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hadn't blown my arms off, Mom  never woulda started smoking in the  first place. Now shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence and watches  Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ON EVAN
dialogues.text: As new sounds ECHO BACKWARD. There's a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen. He is only seven  years old. He coughs up Lucky Charms that have "magically appeared in his mouth. On a journal before him is the rec written passage:

dialogues.speaker: JOURNAL ENTRY
dialogues.text: "Today Mommy is taking me to play with Kayley and Tommy. will mete there father and see what a real dad is like." Andrea is nowhere in sight. Evan springs to his feet and  flexes his real hands triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Now how do I destroy the  blockbuster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rummages through the utensil drawer and pulls out a la butcher knife and grabs it. He tucks it into his sock but won't fit. He's still debating what to do when: ANDREA WALKS IN and is startled by the unexpected sight o Evan holding a huge knife. Evan sees her but remains expressionless. Andrea's face  blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan? What are you doing with that  knife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan comes to to find Lenny still staring at him. Waiting for something big to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that didn't work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan flips a single page of his journal and tries again. reads to himself, then relaxes his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, seven again, stands in the basement dressed in his  Robin Hood costume as Mr. Miller prepares for the sex sce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in this part of the story, Robin  Hood just married Maid Marian and  they have to kiss and stuff like  grown-ups do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh giggles. There seems to be a new glint of  intelligence in Evan's eyes as he adjusts to his new  surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I need my belt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller is puzzled, but watches Evan SKIP to the firep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly childlike) Loo loo, skip to my loo. Loo loo,  skip to my loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller puts his eye back to the viewfinder as Evan qu finds Mr. Miller's old army thermos in the bottom drawer the dresser, opens it and shakes out the blockbuster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loo, loo, skip to my loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to crack it with his own hands, but his seven-ye old body is too weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid, don't bother with the belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller finally turns around and sees Evan banging the blockbuster on the table. Shock registers in Mr. Miller's eyes and he takes a step towards Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, fuckbag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller freezes on that, and Evan smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. That word never fails to  make an impression with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller takes a slow, non-threatening step toward Evan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy does it, Evan! Don't be a bad  boy or I'll tell mommy you were  naughty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll tell the Child Protective  Services about your kiddie porn  endeavors. One step closer and I'll  shove this up your ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh's mouth hangs open with utter amazement at the s Tommy, hiding at the top of the stairs, slowly creeps dow to get a better view. Evan rummages in the bureau and finds the wooden "strike  anywhere" matches used at thirteen to light his cigarette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's dangerous! You could blow  your hands off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been there, done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, standing near the fireplace, defiantly strikes the  match with this thumb and lowers the flame to the short f Mr. Miller charges Evan just as the fuse is lit! Mr. Mill knocks the blockbuster from Evan's hand and it rolls towa the other side of the room, resting peacefully against th video camera. Kayleigh's eyes are dazzled by the sparkling fuse and she bends down to pick it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh! NOOOOOooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The blast is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, twenty, wakes up with a bloody nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Kayleigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan gets a new series of QUICK IMAGES and FLASHED FACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan (now seven) is institutionalized before a judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan (seven through twelve) GROWS UP in an institution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan undergoes years of therapy under Redfield's care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan lies in a room, same posters from college adorn the  walls. Blood flows freely now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing uncontrollably) Kayleigh... no! You can't die again!  I won't let this happen. I won't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan fights off the pain and looks under his bed for  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His journals are missing! He runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan runs into Dr. Redfield's office just as another pati is leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Evan. What's the big rush? We  don't meet for another hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my goddamn books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My journals! Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor looks heartbroken, as if Evan has had a relaps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kills me to have to go through  this again. There are no journals.  There never were. It's part of this  fantasy world your mind created to  cope with the guilt of killing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan looks stunned. Refusing to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think Evan. You've invented a disease  that doesn't exist. Alternate  universes with colleges, prisons,  paraplegia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I... I need those books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remind me of your father. He  always screamed for a photo album  even though he never had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan's eyes roll back and he collapses lifelessly to the  floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan lies on a platform and gets another series of CAT-sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, no longer incapacitated, stares out the window into the darkness. Alone. Trapped. Hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later that day, Dr. Redfield posts the new CAT-scan slide on the light box and shudders when he sees the results. A looks on anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, biting her nails, is unable to conceal her fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dances, just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (devastated) The hemorrhaging... the neural damage  is irreparable. I'm frankly surprised  he still has use of his motor  functions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea begins to break down in tears. Evan secretly liste in from the hallway. His gaunt face looks deep in thought. He takes a breath a enters the lab, making sure not to look directly at his  weeping mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mom, didja remember to bring  those goofy old home movies we used  to make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea wipes tears away, nodding in advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sees no one is watching him in the institution corri as he throws his weight into the door of the doctor's off breaking it open. Sporadically, severe VIBRATIONS invade Evan's environment threatening to distract him from his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan enters the office and tears the file cabinets apart, looking for something. His nose bleeds profusely and he repeatedly wipes the blo off his face with irritation. Evan sees a cardboard marked TREBORN, E. Grabs it and hid under the doctor's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHLIGHT BEAMS stab through the darkened corridor hunti for him. An ALARM SOUNDS. GUARDS are shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, under the doctor's desk, grabs some paper and begin writing in shorthand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone finds this, then I guess  my plan didn't work and I'm already  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, the world flutters as if it were attached to a pai shaker. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I -- I can just go back to the  beginning of all this, I might be  able to save her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fatigue overwhelms him, but he continues writing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Redfield catches up with the rest of the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in his room. Search the  grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cardboard box is overturned. Evan finishes threading SUPER-8 film projector and turns it on. Careful not to le any light spill against the wall, Evan projects it at the underside of the desk. We see familiar home movie footage from his childhood: Le 5, has a birthday party. Kayleigh is there.

dialogues.speaker: EVAN'S EYES
dialogues.text: Getting lost in the memory. CHAOTIC NOISES of CHILDREN'S PARTY bleed into Evan's real The world SHUDDERS UNCONTROLLABLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, 5, comes to at a birthday party. He's unexpectedly  gently prodded forward by Andrea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Evan. Introduce yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan slowly approaches Kayleigh, only five. She smiles  bashfully at him. An old memory comes back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my folks split, they gave me  and Tommy a choice who we wanted to  live with. I couldn't stand my dad,  but I knew if I lived with my mom,  I'd never see you again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan slowly looks around the yard, taking in the reality this distant memory. He even inhales the aroma of the place. Savoring the mome He locks eyes with Kayleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not usually this shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time. Evan leans over to Kayleigh as if he's about t kiss her. Then whispers in her ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you. If you ever come near me  again, I'll kill you and your whole  family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayleigh reacts predictably. Bursting into tears and runs into Kayleigh's mother's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to her? What  happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan ignores them. He can't take his eyes off Kayleigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan wakes up with a bloody nose. He grabs a pillow and c his head with it as a flood of memories seizes him. Lenny (looking fit) grabs a towel from atop an award-winn flatworms project and hands it to Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright? Should I call the doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan groans and shakes his head "no". He rides out the pa like a seasoned pro. When it finally subsides, he lowers the pillow and smiles feebly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think I'll be alright this time. (a new hope) I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lenny nods, still concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan opens the door to a concrete room with a large furna He and Lenny carry cardboard boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan nods. They silently dump tons of journals into the f Evan steps outside and returns with a box of home movies, photo albums, old report cards, etc. In they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burning journals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, a suit now, walks down a city street cradling a cel phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, Ma. I'm running a little late  for lunch. One of my patients had a  breakdown. Anyway, order some soup  in the meantime. See ya soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he clicks off, an attractive woman wearing a power sui approaches from the other direction. Evan has to look clo but it's Kayleigh. A mature woman, now. He stumbles slightly, caught off guard. As she passes, he eyes linger on his a little longer than necessary, but th no recognition. Evan watches her continue past him and do the sidewalk. After a hesitant beat, he takes a breath, turns around an follows her. FADE TO BLACK. Roll credits...
